file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 05-50-12-07 - CONFIG-2 - TOILET OVERSERVICING - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TOILET OVERSERVICING - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do a general cleaning after a toilet overservicing. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) 05-50-12-100-801-A TOILET OVERSERVICING - CLEANING EMB-135 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 05-50-12 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 05-50-12-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. TOILET OVERSERVICING - CLEANING A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to do a toilet overservicing cleaning. (2) Overservicing can be detected by observing a "blue streak" on the vent line side of the fuselage. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 251 251HF Lavatory compartment floor D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Standard tool Vacuum Cleaner Wet vac moisture E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Lavatory Compartment I. Toilet Overservicing - Cleaning (Figure 701) SUBTASK 160-006-B WARNING: PREVENT CONTACT WITH THE LAVATORY FLUIDS DURING MAINTENANCE OR SERVICE IN THE LAVATORY AREA. • PUT ON SAFETY GOGGLES. • PUT ON SAFETY CLOTHES. (1) Wet vac the over serviced moisture fallen on the lavatory and passenger cabin floor. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 CONFIG-2 05-50-12 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Remove the carpet, floor path emergency light system and floor panel 251HF of lavatory compartment (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (3) Wet vac and make sure that all excess of overserviced moisture possibly fallen through the toilet and passenger cabin floor panel, was drained. (4) Make a detailed inspection on the bleed duct flange to make sure that there is no remaining moisture over the flange. NOTE: If there is moisture on the flange, it can cause smoke in the cabin and activate the lavatory and baggage compartment smoke detector. (5) Install the floor panel 251HF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100), floor path emergency light system and carpet of lavatory compartment. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 CONFIG-2 05-50-12 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
